intro: Octomeria ximenae, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring. The tree has a spreading canopy with pinnately compound leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types. Octomeria ximenae is also valued in ecological restoration projects for its ability to thrive in disturbed environments.
